entry.title: [Demo Blog Post] Fed Watching
entry.summary:

entry.content:
By Group "Fintech Disruption"

One of the two main objectives of this project is to find some pattern between the speeches made by FED personnel throughout the year and the impact, if any, they have on the FED Fund Rate.

Background Information on the Fed

The Fed has mainly three appointed positions—the Chair, the Vice Chair and the Governor. Out of these three positions the Chair holds the highest stature and is often viewed as the main answerable authority of the FED. The Vice Chair and Governors are other members in the seven board committee appointed by the President of the United States.

As a famous hedge fund manager once said:

Fed watching is a great tool to make money. I have been making all my gazillions using this technique.

The code we use is as follows:

import gensim
import pandas as pd
DF = pd.read_csv('FED-data.csv')

entry.content:
By Group "Super NLP"

In the previous blog, our team shows the progress we made in data mining and preprocessing. This blog we will guide you through our sentiment analysis toward XRP related tweets.

Financial Data

Before we can start the sentiment analysis, we found that part of the financial data of XRP we loaded from Yahoo Finance was missing. Specifically, the data on October 12, 2020 was missing in the Yahoo Finance database. So we chose Investing.com to get the whole year data of XRP and recalculated the return and 30 days volatility.

The code we use is as follows:

import nltk
import pandas as pd
myvar = 8
DF = pd.read_csv('XRP-data.csv')
